{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3001756,"name":"John","username":"QuickFingers","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/q/f6c823/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-02-02T03:33:46.789Z","cooked":"

Our team uses Xbox controllers, and in our program we define them as such.

Our controllers, when connected to our windows laptops via usb, would spontaneously disconnect from our robot and they would throw either warnings (ie warning: joystick button not available…) or errors (ie error: joystick unexpected disconnected while robot was enabled).

We tried to troubleshoot it (restart driver station, restart robot code, reboot rio, changed controllers, moved them around, changed computers, restarting computers) and nothing so far worked. Has anyone else experienced this error and figured out a way to tackle it?

P.S. every time the driver station log claimed our controllers were disconnected we checked the driver station controllers tab to see if we had inputs and we did.
